tweet: Where are you, Bitcoin "cypherpunks", when an honest project such as #Monero is delisted (with no legal reason) from some exchanges because literally it is *too private*?  I can deal with you screaming shitcoin, and happily educate against.  I am at loss for you doing noting.

Evidently, OkEX has delisted Monero due to KYC/AML considerations.  I understand why exchanges feel compelled to drop coins in which they cannot enforce kyc/AML. Still very sad to see legitimate projects lose traction.  Trustworthy DEX'es can't get here soon enough.
When an exchange delists Monero because of KYC/AML concerns is that a win for the Monero?
@SatoshiLite @giacomozucco Yeah.. can't risk hidden inflation. For all we know monero and zcash might have this problem right now.

@matt_odell @gladstein @aantonop @PeterMcCormack @giacomozucco you should be defending this.  I struggle to understand the lack of support for Monero, a honest privacy-preserving project, when it is attacked *first in line* by regulation for the very principles Bitcoin is about.

We discuss Litecoin's hash rate decline, Monero's Randomx fork and the associated bot nets being used to mine it, and DigiByte's delisting from Poloniex because of a tweet. WhaleBearMan also shills us cookies and tells a disturbing sex toy story   https://t.co/khi3gRxf72  https://t.co/k6dph92G9T
Use @Monero to keep your wealth private. Use Bitcoin at your own risk.

This week we talked to @waxwing__ about Bitcoin privacy and SNICKER, a non-interactive two-party variant of coinjoin. We also discussed:  - Joinmarket - Payjoin / p2ep - Wasabi & Samourai Wallet - Confidential Transactions - Zcash & Monero  Be sure to check it out!
